intro: Anchietea raimondii, commonly known as the Raimondi's anchietea, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes buckwheats and sorrels. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, clustered flowers that bloom in late spring. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a slightly hairy texture. Anchietea raimondii is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments.
